supporting_text: The NAP aims to preserve the effectiveness of antimicrobials for future generations by taking a One Health approach across people, animals, food and the environment.
The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including infection prevention and control, public engagement, and education.
The NAP includes commitments to support the veterinary profession and improve antimicrobial stewardship in animal health.
The NAP includes commitments to implement effective waste management and wastewater treatment methods to minimize dissemination of AMR into the environment.
The NAP supports efforts to optimise the use of antimicrobials in farming globally.
A short report summarising progress made against the NAP will be published annually.
The NAP includes specific targets such as preventing any increase in drug-resistant infections and reducing total antibiotic use in human populations by 5%.
The NAP sets targets for preventing increases in specific drug-resistant infections and reducing total antibiotic use.
The document does not specify budget allocations for the strategies or actions.
The document does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
Oversight will be provided by a UK-wide, intersectoral AMR strategy board.
The NAP includes commitments to promote responsible antimicrobial use and stewardship in healthcare and agriculture.
The NAP includes commitments to work with schools and educators to consider guidance and information on IPC and AMR.
The NAP includes commitments to launch and evaluate evidence-based campaigns to raise public awareness and understanding of AMR.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of international collaboration and engagement with global leaders to address AMR.
The NAP includes commitments to enhance technical capacity for surveillance across sectors to inform intervention development.
The NAP includes commitments to strengthen surveillance capabilities to detect and respond to AMR threats.
The NAP includes commitments to improve IPC and biosecurity practices to minimize infection transmission.
The NAP supports the adoption of internationally agreed best practices, such as the Codex Alimentarius guidelines.
The NAP includes commitments to support appropriate prescribing and disposal of antimicrobials.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of responsible antimicrobial use and stewardship in healthcare and agriculture.
The NAP includes commitments to fund and deliver innovative scientific research to develop vaccines, diagnostics, and antimicrobials.
